Summary: Bright circle of light. No blinking of colored lights.
trends: There have been 173 other sightings in Houston
There were no other sightings in Houston on or around November 18th 2007
divs: Sighting DetailsOn the night of November 18, 2007, I was flying into Houston on flight CO 1848. It was around 9:05 when the pilot announced we would be landing in Houston in about 10 minutes and to fasten our seatbelts. I was sitting 3 or 4 seats behind the left wing of the 737. I was staring outside my window into the pitch blackness of the night wondering just where my location could be if I was 10 minutes from Houston. Suddenly, a bright circle of light (like a headlight from a car) started falling straight down from the sky with extreme speed. My first impression was, "Where did this bright moon come from". I quickly realized it was too bright and it was quickly falling straight down. I elbowed my wife and she saw a few seconds of the light falling. As I was watching the light, the wing of the 737 got in the way of my view. I thought to myself... " I'll just wait until it reapears again under the wing". To my surprise it did reapear for a second or two, but then, without slowing its' speed, it suddenly sped to the left (towards the back of the plane). The pattern was a perfect "L" (but backward). My wife looked at me and asked," What was that?" I was shocked and spooked because I could not believe what I had just seen. I even forgot to mention it to the flight attendent or the pilots. I am pretty sure the pilot saw something also because it happened towards his frontal left side of his seat. Needless to say, I was not able to sleep much that night just thinking over and over of what I had seen. I bring this incident up now because I wonder... could the 10 minutes from Houston be somewhere over the vicinity of Stephenville, Texas?
